item.title: By: Richard Goemann
item.dc:creator: Richard Goemann
item.description: Noah: Nice, thoughtful column. I agree 100%. A related observation: I have always found it much easier for jurors to believe that witnesses are honestly mistaken or confused, rather than lying (again, as you observe, other than a snitch). On a less substantive note: Great final line to the post. Really nails the point in memorable, visceral language.
item.content:encoded:
Noah: Nice, thoughtful column. I agree 100%. A related observation: I have always found it much easier for jurors to believe that witnesses are honestly mistaken or confused, rather than lying (again, as you observe, other than a snitch).
On a less substantive note: Great final line to the post. Really nails the point in memorable, visceral language.
